messages.message: How do I dismiss this banner? Rather than a banner could we put an indication in the UI somewhere? Somewhere near the preview / create app buttons?

Good feedback - it was persistent so that the user knows they have edit access until they lose the lock. The intention is to encourage the user to make changes while they have exclusive edit access.

@Paul H @Siya flagging feedback to you both. Maybe we can sync on this to rethink the notification to be less invasive.

In converse, we have a close button to dismiss the banner. Something like that can be useful here?
Can make it reappear on reload if we want to make it persistent - won't be good UX though
@Lee can you explain why you want to dismiss the banner? i want to make sure i understand your concern

@Siya we use this element elsewhere which is dismissable. And as it is so obtrustive its annoying being there when you’re working on the project.

I was thinking something like the screenshot below, where the first time you open a project where you get ‘edit lock’ a modal pops up to tell you what that means. Then there is a pill in the corner showing your current lock status

Thanks, I understand your concern. I like your idea of onboarding the user with a bit more explanation on what a read only mode/edit lock means.
On the UI indication itself, we need to invest more time on the design as we work towards collaboration.

I'll work with hannah & paul to improve control over the notification.
